Review.author: TS
Review.title: Beware. I received this camera and it would not ...

Text.text: I received this camera and it would not connect to wifi on a PC, windows phone, or an apple Ipad.
The support website states that you should update the firm ware.....by wifi?
Do you see the issue.
The other way is manual, one must first download software from their site then transfer it to your microSD card.
The only problem is once you placed in the camera it is now write protected.
Now you can't write the software to the disk and it won't re-format.
The customer support had no idea how to solve the issue.
This is going back ASAP.
Buyer beware!

Review.author: Stace W.
Review.title: I was at a destination wedding and I got to see all the unique features and how awesome this technology is even for an average p

Text.text: When I first saw a commercial for a GoPro, I was a little hesitant to purchase as I do not do any of the extreme action and adventure activities that are featured on TV/YouTube.
I was at a destination wedding and I got to see all the unique features and how awesome this technology is even for an average person.
The camera takes great pictures and videos!
I use it mainly on vacation for snorkeling, ziplines, etc.
I also bought a few mounts and various attachments (sold separately) and I have worn the camera while completing a Spartan Sprint and Tough Mudder.
It truly does get great action shots (and fairly decent sound).
I also have used my GoPro for longer videos to create a time lapse (put a mount on my deck to catch some nice sunsets).
This thing is great.
I love the iOS app control feature, verrrry handy.
Video quality is purdy good.
Best product I got
I gave the GoPro Hero 4 a 5 star rating and in my opinion the 3+ deserves a 4 star rating.
Could have easily received a 5 star rating, but the lack of support in firmware upgrades creates some disappointment.
Riddle me this GoPro.
Why would you update the Hero 3 with protune and not the 3+.
The 3+ is newer and capable of 1080p 60FPS.
For those who do not post process, this may not be a big issue, but for people like me, having the option of protune is a blessing.
The action camera functions like new.
It has become my main drone camera or sacrificial lamb in case of drone mishap.
Thus saving my Hero 4 from a high risk adventure.
People have a tendency to shy away from certified refurbished cameras, where they can save a lot of money.
Electronic problems are easy to correct and that is based on if the camera had problems.
Many electronic items are returned without any problems.
Maybe I should knock on wood, but I never had one problem with a refurbished item.....
This is a great bundle deal.

Highly recommend.

Text.text: I purchased this as a gift for my husband.
He had expressed wanting it and although I thought it was an unnecessary expense, I got it for him anyway.
He has used it several times.
He attached it to the head gear and used it while bike riding, tubing on a lake, zip lining and hiking.
He also attached it to his gas powered RC car.
I have to say, I was pretty impressed with the quality of picture.
My assumption was that it would also be very 'bouncy' and hard to watch, but it really wasn't!
The picture was SUPER clear and crisp.
There was no shaking or unsteadiness.
Now, we take it everywhere!
I love that we can get such great video of events that we would otherwise only have memories of.

Review.author: PattyCO
Review.title: White water rafting - the Go is a go!

Text.text: OK, It's not my Canon D70, but then I can't take my D70 white water rafting.
The camera is everything promised and then some.
I recently took the camera white water rafting through Royal Gorge (level 4/5).
Set the camera to take 1 shot per second.
Got some outstanding action shots (love the ones of my girlfriend falling out of the raft).
Although the pictures were more wide angle than I thought they would be, the pictures came out very clear and I was able to get many pictures I would not otherwise have gotten.
The camera did not fog up (I was using anti-fog strips) and worked great through rapids and many high impact situations.
Had no problems with waterproofing.
Looking forward to hooking it to my Honda Goldwing and shooting while riding.
I think this will be a great camera for its intended purpose - action shots on the go.
So far I love it.

Review.author: stefan i rahovean
Review.title: Great product! Out of focus right out of the box.

Text.text: Amazing camera, poor quality control!
I bought this camera brand new on Dec 26th 2014 mainly to film my tennis matches as well as other fun activities.
The camera worked great during my first match, however, when I uploaded the movie onto my computer, I noticed that the focus was way off (everything that was farther than 10 feet away was blurry.

After reading a bunch of blogs and forums, I came across a mod on youtube that suggested that the gopro 3+ doesn't have infinity focus and in order to fix it you have to rotate the lens clockwise about 2 mm.
I tried that, and the focus was even worse.

It took me a few hours outside with my iPad in order to get the focus right, and eventually I got it just right for Medium field of view 94 degrees (much better for filming a tennis match than the 123 degrees of wide view).
The 2 stars rating is just because I expected the new camera to be focused for $300.
On the bright side, I learned a lot about photography and lenses during the painful week of trying to figure out how to focus the damn thing :)

I love my GoPro Hero3+ Silver Edition.
I think this camera is the best GoPro for the value and features.
I researched extensively the other GoPro cameras and came to the conclusion that for the price and quality this is the best camera in the group.
Going down a level you do not get the wifi connection and gopro app functionality, going up gives you higher resolutions and an LCD screen of which I actually didnt want on my GoPro.
The wifi integration with your smart phone works very well so if you absolutely need a screen to look at this is your best option.
I felt the very nature of the GoPro was not intended to have an LCD screen thus turning it into a smaller version of a point and shoot camera.
That being said I get a lot of use out of this version and really enjoy the wifi connectivity.
Keeping the wifi on continually does drain the battery very quickly as it does for all versions of the GoPro.
Got what I paid for and more!!!

Review.author: Jennifer Baldwin
Review.title: GoPro Sucks - Don't Waste Your Money

Text.text: Warning - NEVER purchase a GoPro!
We bought one January 2014 and started having problems with it in June 2014.
I didn't think much of it being pregnant, working full-time, and getting ready for our baby to arrive.
We tried to use it during a trip to Sedona (September 2015) and it wouldn't work at all so we missed capturing some firsts with our little guy.
Yesterday I spent about 30 minutes on the phone with tech support and hours on my own researching and trying to get it to work.
It freezes as soon as I turn the power on.
Since it's no longer under warranty we are out the $400 we spent on a camera that we used probably 5 times (no more than 10 guaranteed).
The issues with my GoPro are very common so it's a faulty product they made and knew there were problems.
They encourage me to send my camera in to them and purchase a brand new one though.
Why would I purchase another camera when the first one doesn't work and they don't even stand behind their product when they know it was poorly made?
Not only will I not purchase anything else from them, but I will share my story whenever possible.
#RIPGoPro #GoProSucks

Review.author: Jennifer
Review.title: Bad product and horrible GoPro product support

Text.text: This GoPro was used one time and it died, it stopped working.
It's six month after I purchased it and I still don't have a replacement.
Because I purchased it as a Christmas gift I lost the replacement window with the Amazon re-seller so I was forced to go to GoPro customer service which is horrible.
GoPro support has given me the run-around by not getting all the information they need and then sending me multiple emails requesting additional information.
They sent me a new batter finally at the end of April to see if that would work and as soon as the battery shipped they closed my case.
The new battery did NOT work.
I've spent a lot of time just trying to get customer support on the phone again because it's seems impossible to set up a new case online.
It's frustration and anger that no consumer should have experience after spending $243 for a tiny product that does not work.
Never again!!
I will not purchase high end electronic devices for Christmas gifts on Amazon unless the return policy period is at lease 3-6 months and even then that is questionable.
I've read other reviews out on the internet and have seen the same complaints from other consumers.
Next time I'll pay closer attention.

Don't use

Review.author: Nathan Strietelmeier
Review.title: This camera will break within 13 months

Text.text: GoPro has the worst customer service I have ever seen.
I paid over 500 dollars for my GoPro and even more on the accessories... Just to have it stop working 13 months later.... 1 month past the warranty.
I didn't fly my camera over volcanoes....
I didn't jump out of a plane with my GoPro....
I didn't dive into the salty oceans with my GoPro....
I didn't even get my GoPro wet.
I filmed myself walking my dog and it still broke after 13 months.
GoPro customer service asked me to mail them my old camera and pay another 350 dollars for a new one.
I was stupid for buying a GoPro camera.
But I am not that stupid to mail them my broken 500 dollar camera and then pay another 350 dollars for a new one.
Do You want to spend hundreds of dollars on a camera that has the worst customer service and a camera that will break within 13 months?
Then go ahead a waste your money and buy a GoPro camera... Just remember when it breaks and stops working...
I told you so.

On the second day I thought the camera had died.
I had taken the battery out and did not replace it right.
It seams to be working great now.
I own the hero 3+ and hero 3.
Both take amazing video.
The wide viewing angle and resolution are phenomenal.
I've had many water proof video cameras like Olympus stylus', Kodak, and Fujis but none rival GoPro in picture quality viewing angle and versatility.
GoPros are mountable to just about anything for hands free filming.
I've used them cliff diving, hiking, canyoneering, and climbing and they are so light weight you hardly notice you have them on.
Having two GoPros is a must so you can film and have an adventure partner film you too.
The water tight case is very durable, scratch resistant, and I've rarely had fogging problems.
Everything about GoPros is top quality.
I would not ever consider anything but a GoPro for an action camera.
They are like the iPhone's of the action camera world.
I have a feeling this company will be on the cutting edge of adventure technology for many years.
Let's hope they follow Apples business strategy and only make high quality devices.
I hope to get a Karma drone soon.
As good as GoPros are they can still improve.
Longer battery life would be a plus.
GPS tracking with your smart phone would also be great so if you drop your go pro you can find it.
Solar and kinetic self charging to extend battery life would be awesome.
MP3 player with blue tooth should come standard and you should be able to use wifi and down load smart phone apps.

This camera is rated tops (actually the Black Edition) by scuba.com for beginning underwater photographers.
I don't think one needs the professional features of the Black Edition so I purchased the silver edition and I'll be just fine.
I saved $100 which I needed to purchase accessories that are required.

If you are going to use this camera underwater, the housing is just fine but you will also need to purchase: 1) An SD card, 2) an extra battery and charger, 3) a red filter or filter set, 4) a waterproof and, preferably, shock proof case, 5) a micro HDMI cable, 6) a floaty backdoor, 7) a floating wrist strap and 8) a floating grip extension.
In addition, you might want a head strap and gripster tripod with tripod mounting adapter.

I do have some cons:
The videos from this GoPro are HD, so it does just what I need.
You can also take pictures with it as well.
I purchased it used so connecting it through the GoPro app was never possible, which is why it is receiving 4 stars rather than 5.
It does not have a screen to view your videos, but for the price I don't mind.
While doing anything even remotely adventurous, the last thing you'll want to be doing is running the batteries viewing a screen anyways.
I've realized without a screen, I just keep recording rather than stopping every 2 minutes to view the video, which has allowed me to get really good footage.
For the price of this one compared to the newest GoPro, this one is definitely worth it.

Text.text: We are happy with these genuine refurb Hero3+ cameras sold by SupremeDealsCR.
Fast shipping and they have all the accessories included.

Review.author: Guy
Review.title: Not convinced it was actually refurbished

Text.text: I got the GoPro Hero3+ (refurbished) and it was a mistake.
The battery was too swollen to fit into the camera.
Amazon offered me partial refund to buy a new battery so I did.
After recording something and trying to upload to the computer, the camera turns itself off every few seconds so it can't even upload.
Seems like it was returned before, but I am not convinced it was actually refurbished.
great product!
